Themes

Themes allow you to change the basic look of MineDroid widgets.

Creating a theme

Right now you can create theme only by extending com.onkiup.minecraft.gui.themes.DefaultTheme or by implementing com.onkiup.minecraft.gui.themes.Theme interface.

Setting a theme

To set theme, you should put instance of theme class to a field OnkiupGuiManager.theme

Theme interface methods

  • public int getFontColor() — should return default text color;
  • public float getFontSize() — should return default text scale (1 = no scale, 2 = double scale);
  • public float getHeaderSize() — should return default header text scale;
  • public Drawable getOverlayDrawable() — should return default overlay window drawable;
  • public Drawable getOverlayBackgroundDrawable() — should return default overlay window background (shadow) drawable;
  • public Rect getDefaultPadding() — should return default padding for any inflated element;
  • public Rect getDefaultMargin() — should return default margin for any inflated element;
  • public Drawable getButtonBackground() — should return default button drawable;

Future plans

Future versions will add a possibility to create themes from XML files.
